item.title: Book of Genesis
item.description: Book of Genesis The Book of Genesis is the first book of the Hebrew Bible and the Christian Old Testament .

item.title: Book of Exodus
item.description: Book of Exodus The Book of Exodus is the second book of the Bible.

item.title: Book Of Leviticus
item.description: Book of Leviticus The book of Leviticus is the third book of the Torah (the Pentateuch) and of the Old Testament , also known as the Third Book of Moses.

item.title: Book Of Numbers
item.description: Book of Numbers The book is basically the sacred history of the Israelites as they wandered in the wilderness following the departure from Sinai and before their occupation of Canaan, the Promised Land.

item.title: Book Of Deuteronomy
item.description: Book of Deuteronomy Deuteronomy, Hebrew Devarim, (“Words”), fifth book of the Old Testament , written in the form of a farewell address by Moses to the Israelites before they entered the Promised Land of Canaan.

item.title: Book Of Joshua
item.description: Book of Joshua Joshua leads Israel to settle in the promised land.

item.title: Book Of Judges
item.description: Book of Judges The Book of Judges (ספר שופטים, Sefer Shoftim) is the seventh book of the Hebrew Bible and the Christian Old Testament .

item.title: Book Of Ruth
item.description: Book of Ruth The Book of Ruth relates that Ruth and Orpah, two women of Moab, had married two sons of Elimelech and Naomi, Judeans who had settled in Moab to escape a famine in Judah.

item.title: Book Of 1 Samuel
item.description: Book of 1 Samuel The book of 1 Samuel outlines the fall of King Saul and David’s rise to the throne as a humble servant of God.

item.title: Book Of 2 Samuel
item.description: Book of 2 Samuel The book of 2 Samuel continues to show us the virtue of humility, the destructiveness of pride, and the faithfulness of God’s promise.

item.title: Book Of 1 Kings
item.description: Book of 1 Kings The book of 1 Kings provides an account of the death of David, the reign of his son Solomon, and the decline and division of the Kingdom of Israel after Solomon and many of his successors turned to idol worship.

item.title: Book Of 2 Kings
item.description: Book of 2 Kings The book of 2 Kings describes the history of the Northern Kingdom of Israel and the Southern Kingdom of Judah, focusing on the spiritual successes and failures of each kingdom.

item.title: Book Of 1 Chronicles
item.description: Book of Chronicles 1 and 2 Chronicles summarizes the Hebrew Bible with key highlights that emphasize God’s love for his chosen people.

item.title: Book Of 2 Chronicles
item.description: Book of Chronicles 1 and 2 Chronicles summarizes the Hebrew Bible with key highlights that emphasize God’s love for his chosen people.

item.title: Book Of Ezra
item.description: Book of Ezra The book of Ezra provides an account of the return of two groups of Jews from Babylon to Jerusalem, where they rebuilt the temple and their community.

item.title: Book Of Nehemiah
item.description: Book of Nehemiah The Book of Nehemiah in the Hebrew Bible, largely takes the form of a first-person memoir concerning the rebuilding of the walls of Jerusalem after the Babylonian exile by Nehemiah, a Jew who is a high official at the Persian court, and the dedication of the city and its people to God’s laws (Torah).

item.title: Book Of Esther
item.description: Book of Esther The book relates the story of a Hebrew woman in Persia, born as Hadassah but known as Esther, who becomes queen of Persia and thwarts a genocide of her people.

item.title: Book Of Job
item.description: Book of Job This story concerns Job, a prosperous man of outstanding piety.

item.title: Book Of Psalms
item.description: Book Of Psalms The book of Psalms is an intricately designed collection of poetry that recounts Israel’s history and God’s covenant promises.

item.title: Book Of Proverbs
item.description: Book of Proverbs The book of Proverbs shares short sayings of God’s wisdom.

item.title: Book Of Ecclesiastes
item.description: Book Of Ecclesiastes Ecclesiastes, Hebrew Qohelet, (Preacher), an Old Testament book of wisdom literature that belongs to the third section of the biblical canon, known as the Ketuvim (Writings).

item.title: Song of Solomon
item.description: Song of Solomon Song of Solomon, also called Canticle of Canticles, or Song of Songs, an Old Testament book that belongs to the third section of the biblical canon, known as the Ketuvim, or “Writings.

item.title: Book Of Isaiah
item.description: Book Of Isaiah Book of Isaiah, also spelled Isaias, one of the major prophetical writings of the Old Testament .

item.title: Book Of Jeremiah
item.description: Book Of Jeremiah The Book of Jeremiah, also called The Prophecy Of Jeremias, one of the major prophetical writings of the Old Testament .

item.title: Book Of Lamentations
item.description: Book Of Lamentations The Lamentations of Jeremiah, also called The Lamentations Of Jeremias, Old Testament book belonging to the third section of the biblical canon, known as the Ketuvim, or Writings.

item.title: Book Of Ezekiel
item.description: Book Of Ezekiel The Book of Ezekiel, also called The Prophecy of Ezechiel, one of the major prophetical books of the Old Testament .

item.title: Book Of Daniel
item.description: Book Of Daniel The Book of Daniel, also called The Prophecy Of Daniel, a book of the Old Testament found in the ‘Ketuvim’ (Writings), the third section of the Jewish canon, but placed among the Prophets in the Christian canon.

item.title: Book Of Hosea
item.description: Book Of Hosea Book of Hosea, also spelled Osee, the first of 12 Old Testament books that bear the names of the Minor Prophets , considered as one book, The Twelve, in the Jewish canon.

item.title: Book Of Joel
item.description: Book Of Joel Book of Joel, second of 12 Old Testament books that bear the names of the Minor Prophets .

item.title: Book Of Amos
item.description: Book Of Amos Book of Amos, the third of 12 Old Testament books that bear the names of the Minor Prophets , collected in one book under the Jewish canon titled The Twelve.

item.title: Book Of Obadiah
item.description: Book Of Obadiah Book of Obadiah, also spelled Abdias, the fourth of 12 Old Testament books that bear the names of the Minor Prophets , in the Jewish canon treated as one book, The Twelve.

item.title: Book Of Jonah
item.description: Book Of Jonah Book of Jonah, also spelled Jonas, the fifth of 12 Old Testament books that bear the names of the Minor Prophets , embraced in a single book, The Twelve, in the Jewish canon.

item.title: Book Of Micah
item.description: Book Of Micah Book of Micah, the sixth of 12 Old Testament books that bear the names of the Minor Prophets , grouped together as The Twelve in the Jewish canon.

item.title: Book Of Nahum
item.description: Book Of Nahum Book of Nahum, the seventh of 12 Old Testament books that bear the names of the Minor Prophets (grouped together as The Twelve in the Jewish canon).

item.title: Book Of Habakkuk
item.description: Book Of Habakkuk The Book of Habakkuk, also called The Prophecy Of Habacuc, the eighth of 12 Old Testament books that bear the names of the Minor Prophets .

item.title: Book Of Zephaniah
item.description: Book Of Zephaniah Book of Zephaniah, also called Sophonias, the ninth of 12 Old Testament books that bear the names of the Minor Prophets , collected in one book, The Twelve, in the Jewish canon.

item.title: Book Of Haggai
item.description: Book Of Haggai The Book of Haggai, also called The Prophecy Of Aggeus, the 10th of 12 Old Testament books that bear the names of the Minor Prophets .

item.title: Book Of Zechariah
item.description: Book Of Zechariah Book of Zechariah, also spelled Zacharias, the 11th of 12 Old Testament books that bear the names of the Minor Prophets , collected in the Jewish canon in one book, The Twelve.

item.title: Book Of Malachi
